posts.post_content:
I won lot # 80166 which was the lot of over 90 OLD MILL backs as I needed a few for a couple of collectors I look for. (  my 7th grade teacher Rosalie Gross would be disappointed in my ending a sentence with a preposition)...  Will be selling the rest of them and you can check out the list and conditions on Heritage if interested. ----Or email me for list in alphabetical order
   Obviously I do not have them in hand yet as auction ended last night . If interested please email me at [url]forazzurri1@aol.com[/url] or cell is 770 873 1181.

on a related note to the above English lesson;

ugly girl not going to the prom." What guy are you going to the prom with?"
pretty,  snotty girl, " You don't end a sentence with a proposition'"
ugly girl..." What guy are you going to the prom with, bitch?"

If there is a Heinie Wagner (bat on left shoulder) in this lot, I would be very interested in taking it off your hands!

Thanks,
Jay

posts.post_content: will be finishing it shortly and will send to everyone who has received the spreadsheet already ( without the prices obviously)

"... as I needed a few for a couple of collectors I look for." ---> "for whom I look." :):):)

HAHA, great grammatical joke .............. and at least you only had to deal with Mrs. Gross your school teacher for a year.  I had a life time of mother and her grammatical policing.  Still shutter to this day when someone misuses "lay" and "lie."



................... like uusal, nothing much added here, Scott :rolleyes:

Email sent, excited for when these come in :)
